basics.name: Noé Demange
basics.label: PhD Student in Computer Science
basics.summary: PhD student in the DAVID Lab (UVSQ / Paris-Saclay University) focusing on algorithms and combinatorial models for the synthesis of organic molecular cages.

work.name: DAVID Laboratory, UVSQ / Paris-Saclay University
work.summary: Doctoral research on path generation between molecular binding patterns to guide the synthesis of organic cages; supervised by Yann Strozecki and Sandrine Vial.

work.name: Laboratoire DAVID, UVSQ
work.summary: Designed algorithms in C for the in silico generation of molecular cages and construction of feasible synthesis paths.

work.name: UVSQ - SaclAI School
work.summary: Supported first-year computer science students with programming, algorithmics, and exam preparation.

work.name: Laboratoire DAVID, UVSQ
work.summary: Improved a molecular cage construction pipeline and implemented the A* algorithm in C for guided searches.

work.name: Paris-Saclay University
work.summary: Promoted the university's academic programs during orientation fairs and outreach events.

work.name: CHCSC, UVSQ
work.summary: Delivered R-based analytical workflows, Shiny dashboards, and Dockerized environments for cultural heritage studies.

work.name: CHCSC, UVSQ
work.summary: Designed a double-seriation methodology for large historical datasets using R.

work.name: Bioinformatics Workshop, ISYEB - MNHN
work.summary: Developed and applied a double-seriation approach on genomic datasets using R under Guillaume Sapriel's supervision.

volunteer.organization: Junior Conference on Informatics: Theory and Applications (JITA)
volunteer.summary: Managed calls for papers, communications, and peer reviews for the student-led conference.

education.area: AMIS Master's Degree (Algorithms and Modeling at the Interface of Sciences)
Double Bachelor's in Biology & Computer Science

entries.name: MaDICS Symposium
entries.summary: Poster on the generation of construction guides for molecular cages.

entries.name: Paris-Saclay University Research Days
entries.summary: Poster on the generation of construction guides for molecular cages.

entries.name: DAVID Lab PhD Students Day
entries.summary: Talk presenting early progress on algorithms that support molecular cage synthesis.

entries.name: L2 internships
entries.summary: Generated binding motifs for molecular cage construction. Supervisors: Noé Demange, Yann Strozecki, Sandrine Vial.

projects.name: Molecular cycle graph comparisons
projects.summary: Built cycle graphs for molecules and compared them via MCIS using C/Python/R in a four-person team (M2 project).

projects.name: Organic molecular cage guides
projects.summary: Extended legacy code to design new path-building strategies for molecular cages (M1 team project).

projects.name: RNA structure prediction with pseudoknots
projects.summary: Implemented the Rivas & Eddy algorithm in C to predict RNA secondary structures (L3 project).
